A surgical instrument system for implanting an interspinous process spacing device, comprising a first arm having a proximal end, an elongated central portion, and a distal end, wherein the distal end has an interspinous process spacing device engagement element for posteriorly engaging a first attachment side of the interspinous process spacing device having a spacer tray extending inwardly therefrom, a second arm having a proximal end, an elongated central portion, and a distal end, wherein the distal end has an interspinous process spacing device engagement element for posteriorly engaging a second attachment side of the interspinous process spacing device having a spacer tray slot therein for receiving the spacer tray, wherein the first arm and the second arm are removably attachable to one another and are configured for advancing the first attachment side and the second attachment side toward one another along an arcuate path.
21. The surgical instrument system of claim 20, wherein the proximal and distal ends of each arm are offset to provide an unobstructed view of the distal ends when holding the proximal ends.

22. The surgical instrument system of claim 20, wherein each engagement element comprises an engagement projection which releasably engages an instrument receptacle on the engaged attachment side of the interspinous spacing device.

23. The surgical instrument system of claim 22, wherein the engagement projection is a threaded screw which releasably engages a reciprocal threaded instrument receptacle on the engaged attachment side of the interspinous spacing device.
24. The surgical instrument system of claim 20, wherein the central portions of the first arm an the second arm are pivotally attachable.

25. The surgical instrument system of claim 20, further comprising a mechanical actuator for obtaining or maintaining a position of the first arm and the second arm during advancement of the first attachment side and the second attachment side toward one another along the arcuate path.

26. The surgical instrument system of claim 25, wherein the mechanical actuator comprises a ratchet bar pivotally mounted to the proximal end of one of the first arm or the second arm and selectively engageable to the proximal end of the other of the first arm and the second arm, wherein the ratchet bar has a plurality of teeth on the proximal surface thereof which engage a corresponding flange on the proximal end of the other of the first arm and the second arm.

27. The surgical instrument system of claim 26, wherein the ratchet bar comprises one or more indicators of predetermined length corresponding to a space between the engaged first and second attachment sides of the interspinous process spacing device.

28. The surgical instrument system of claim 27, wherein the ratchet bar further comprises a threaded track and a nut riding thereon and positionable outside of the proximal end of the other of the first arm and the second arm for mechanically forcing the proximal ends of the arms together.

29. A surgical instrument for selecting an interspinous process spacing device, comprising a first arm having a proximal end, an elongated central portion and distal end, wherein the distal end has a first interspinous process spacing measurement wing extending therefrom comprising a first spinous process stop element and a perpendicular wing template, a second arm having a proximal end, an elongated central portion and distal end, wherein the distal end has a second interspinous process spacing measurement wing extending therefrom comprising a second spinous process stop element and a perpendicular wing template, wherein the first and second arms are pivotally attached about an axis for positioning the first and second interspinous process spacing measurement wings to measure space between adjacent spinal processes.

30. The instrument of claim 29, wherein the first and second wing templates are adapted to overlap respective first and second adjacent spinal processes to determine space available on each spinous process for engaging an interspinous process implant.

31. The instrument of claim 30, wherein the first or second wing template comprises a fastener template extending therefrom adapted to engage with a slot on an attachment side of an interspinous process spacing device previously implanted to determine space and orientation available for overlapping engagement with a linking interspinous process spacing device.

32. The instrument of claim 29, wherein the proximal end of the first or second arm has a measuring element attached thereto with indicia to register length to the proximal end of the other arm, wherein said length corresponds to space between adjacent spinal processes as measured by the first and second spinous process stop elements.
33. The instrument of claim 29, wherein drawing the proximal ends of the arms together separates the wings to measure space between adjacent spinal processes.
